poem:
Reflections on Legacy

In cityscape shadows,  
Zohran stands bright,  
woven in mother's light,  
a tapestry of visions,  
on reels film and life,  
Mira's voice echoes  
through his words—  
frames of change  
in streets, moving  
with legacy's dance.  
Youthful hands  
shape a city's horizon,  
where history whispers  
to present breath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Campaign director: Zohran Mamdani’s ideas are indebted to the films of his mother, Mira Nair When Zohran Mamdani was elected as New York City’s first Muslim mayor and the youngest since 1892, headlines naturally focused on his groundbreaking political rise. But for many, the spotlight also turned to a name that had already long resonated on the global stage – his mother Mira Nair. A pioneering film-maker with a career spanning more than three decades,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
